resources.string:
Player Types 

	Doctors
*About 30 percent of players are assigned initially to this class.
 *High resistance to disease
 *Upon contact with an incubating player, the player reverts to neutral.


	Bio-Warrior
*Only one player per game is assigned to this class. 
*Infected at the start; goal is to infect as many people as possible 
*Upon contact with a neutral player, the player becomes incubating.


	Incubating
*About 20 percent of players are assigned initially to this class. 
*If two days pass since incubation time without being cured by a doctor, the player becomes infected.


	Infected
*No players are assigned initially to this class. 
*If one day passes since infection time without being cured by a doctor, the player becomes dead.


	Dead
*No players are assigned initially to this class. 
*Dead players get game-end notifications. They are still technically "in the game", even if they are inactive - they'll have to wait until the week is up to play again.


	Rules

*RULE 1: If a player turns their phone off during the week, they automatically become dead. This is a blatant workaround; for now, remember that you always have to be alert in the middle of an epidemic! Or something like that. 

*RULE 2: There are no rules. 

*RULE 3: This probably isn't going to end up working. It was still a nice idea, anyway.
